moves.1. d4: I'm most comfortable with Queen's Pawn Gambit
moves.3. Bg5: I'm always mixed on this move. It often ends badly for me.
moves.3... dxc4: Accepts the gambit one move later
moves.4. Bxf6: I decided to double the pawns as I never get a lot of use out of my dark squared bishop anyway
moves.4... gxf6: I was surprised here as it destablizes an king side castle but keeps the king's pawn available for central control
moves.6. d5: I thought the awkward pawn structure was worth keeping. I didn't want to trade queens nor did I like 6. ... exd4
moves.7... Bxc3+: This surprised me. I think it removes his good bishop and allows me a stronger pawn chain
moves.8... f5: Trying to remove his doubled pawns
moves.9. exf5: I thought this was better trying to protect my pawn
moves.10... Be4: Putting pressure on my g pawn.
moves.12... Bxc6: Making the best of the blunder
moves.13. Qxd8+: Up a piece I wanted to trade queens and also prevent any queen side castle
moves.14. Nxe5: I thought about short castle but I wanted to keep the pressure on with a fork threat
moves.14... O-O: Short castle anyway. I thought perhaps 14. ... Bxg2 was better although it ends up even material after 15. Nxf7 Bxh1 16. Nxd8
moves.15. Nxc6: Get rid of the threat of Bxg2 now that my fork is gone. Doubles pawns, eliminates his last Bishop.
moves.16. O-O: Connect the rooks. I thinking just Rd1 hoping for a trade bring my other rook into play. I knew I had to remember back rank checks to which I've fallen victim in the past
moves.16... Rd2: Moving to the second rank which is always strong
moves.18. Re3: Protecting the pawn and thus the Bishop
moves.18... Rb8: Grabbing the open rank and threatening to connect rooks
moves.19. Rf3: Keeping the c pawn protected and attacking his f pawn.
moves.19... Rbb2: Connecting and threating attacks along the 2nd rank
moves.20. Bb3: Trapping his rook where it can't come to help against back rank attacks
moves.22. Re1: Hoping for a back rank mate. Black's only move is Rd8 and then I start snapping up pawns
moves.22... Kg8: Overlooked back rank, I've done it myself more than once
moves.23. Re8#: I'm most comfortable with Queen's Pawn Gambit these days. This game hinged the blunder at move 11.
